topic.title: HPE Helion 2.0 Development Platform: Redis Integration for Developers

ul.li: You already have an ALS cluster.
You have access to the cluster and permission to deploy applications.
Access is allowed into the Redis instance or clustered IP addresses and Redis port 6379. If not, the process for configuring port access is located here.

ol.li:
Create user-provided service in ALS cluster, provide connection credentials
Login to the ALS cluster helion target <ALS cluster end point>helion login
Example:$ helion target api.15.124.133.173.xip.ioSuccessfully targeted to [https://api.15.124.133.173.xip.io] Target: https://api.15.124.133.173.xip.io Organization: <none> Space: <none>$ helion loginAttempting login to [https://api.15.124.133.173.xip.io] Username: myuser@mycompany.com Password: Successfully logged into [https://api.15.124.133.173.xip.io] demo@hpe.com Choosing the one available organization: "default" Choosing the one available space: "default" Target: https://api.15.124.133.173.xip.io Organization: default Space: default
Get a list of all services in the ALS cluster $ helion services
On a new ALS cluster with no services created, you should see an output similar to following:SSL warning for "api.15.124.133.173.xip.io": self signed certificate
============== Service Plans ================
+--------+------+-------------+---------+------+--------+----------+---------+--------+------+ | Vendor | Plan | Description | Details | Free | Public | Provider | Version | Broker | Orgs | +--------+------+-------------+---------+------+--------+----------+---------+--------+------+ +--------+------+-------------+---------+------+--------+----------+---------+--------+------+
=========== Provisioned Services ============
Create a new service for binding Redis from applications in the ALS cluster $ helion create-service user-provided <name of your Redis service>
When prompted, enter the field names to be used for Redis connection credentials. These are not the values, but the names of the fields.
For a single instance Redis, provide field names such as: hostname, port, db.
For a Redis cluster, for example with 3 nodes, provide field names such as: hostname1,hostname2,hostname3,port,db
Enter values for these connection credential fields.
Validate that the new service is available
Check the credentials are set correctly
Bind to Redis user-provided service from an app during deployment
Deploy your application using helion CLI
Validate the service is bound to your application
